properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 12 at 3:22AM CST until February 12 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Grand Forks ND
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Little additional snow. Winds
gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning,
dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45
below zero.

* WHERE...Portions of the northern Red River Valley.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 9 AM this morning to 3
PM CST this afternoon. For the Blizzard Warning, until 9 AM
CST this morning.

* IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce the
visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning
commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below
zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10
minutes.
properties.instruction:
Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at
dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling
5 1 1 in either state.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON
